Recommendation-Declaration-EAW.for_windows: U-value entered does not achieve the standard for upgrading retained thermal elements with insulation as set out in the Building Regulations 2010 (see Table 3, Section 5: Guidance on thermal elements, Approved Document L1B Conservation of fuel and power in existing dwellings). Please tick box to confirm that this work is carried out in accordance with Appendix A: Work to thermal elements, Approved Document L1B Conservation of fuel and power in existing dwellings.
Recommendation-Declaration-EAW.for_wall_floor_roof: U-value entered does not achieve the standard for upgrading retained controlled fittings as set out in the Building Regulations 2010 (see Table 1, Section 4: Guidance relating to building work, Approved Document L1B Conservation of fuel and power in existing dwellings). Please tick box to confirm that this work is carried out in accordance with Approved Document L1B Conservation of fuel and power in existing dwellings.
Recommendation-Declaration-EAW.for_partWall: The Party Wall etc. Act 1996 requires that Adjoining Owners are given notice of the intention to carry out work on a party wall, and contains provisions on preventing or resolving disputes in relation to party walls. Please tick box to confirm that this will be done before the work is undertaken.

Recommendation-Declaration-SCT.for_windows: U-value entered does not achieve the performance recommended for reconstruction of thermal elements and/or replacement of windows as set out within clause 6.2.11 to standard 6.2 of the Building (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (refer to values in column b in the table to clause 6.2.9). Please tick box to confirm that the alternative value entered is assessed as the best performance that can be achieved in improving the thermal element, taking into account both technical risk of improvement and what is ‘reasonably practicable’ and, where works are the subject of a building warrant, that the value is accepted by the verifier.
Recommendation-Declaration-SCT.for_wall_floor_roof: U-value entered does not achieve the performance recommended for reconstruction of thermal elements and/or replacement of windows as set out within clause 6.2.11 to standard 6.2 of the Building (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (refer to values in column b in the table to clause 6.2.9). Please tick box to confirm that the alternative value entered is assessed as the best performance that can be achieved in improving the thermal element, taking into account both technical risk of improvement and what is ‘reasonably practicable’ and, where works are the subject of a building warrant, that the value is accepted by the verifier.
Recommendation-Declaration-SCT.for_partWall: In relation to houses, both owners would normally have rights over a party wall. In relation to flats or maisonettes, the owner needs to be satisfied that he or she has obtained sufficient consent from other owners before carrying out works on communal property. In all cases, the owner will need to be satisfied that he or she has obtained any necessary consents e.g. building warrant, planning or listed building. Please tick box to confirm that the owner has sufficient consent to proceed.

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-EAW: Pitched roof, no access to loft

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-SCT: Pitched roof, no access to loft
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: Access to loft is needed to establish existing loft insulation.

Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: Flat roof insulation improvement requires that the existing insulation is ascertained.

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-EAW: Room rooms, insulation unknown for some or all

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-SCT: Room rooms, insulation unknown for some or all
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: Roof room insulation improvement requires that the existing insulation is ascertained.

Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: A borescope examination is needed to establish whether cavity insulation is already present.

Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-EAW: Some of the walls are system built or of non-conventional construction. It needs to be established that these walls are suitable for cavity insulation.
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: Some of the walls are system built or of non-conventional construction. It needs to be established that these walls are suitable for cavity insulation.

Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-EAW: It should be established whether stone walls are of cavity construction and suitable for cavity fill.
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: It should be established whether stone walls are of cavity construction and suitable for cavity fill.

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-EAW: Cavity wall, fill selected but possible high exposure indicated in EPC addendum

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-SCT: Cavity wall, fill selected but possible high exposure indicated in EPC addendum
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: Suitability for cavity fill should be checked in relation to local exposure conditions and wall construction

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-EAW: Cavity wall, fill selected but access issues indicated in EPC addendum
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-EAW: Establish whether access to applicable walls can be arranged.
Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-SCT: Cavity wall, fill selected but access issues indicated in EPC addendum
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: Establish whether access to applicable walls can be arranged.

Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-EAW: Cavity wall, fill selected but narrow cavities indicated in EPC addendum
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-EAW: The walls may have narrow cavities. This should be checked to establish a suitable type of cavity wall insulation.
Recommendation.Improvement-Situation-SCT: Cavity wall, fill selected but narrow cavities indicated in EPC addendum
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: The walls may have narrow cavities. This should be checked to establish a suitable type of cavity wall insulation.

Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: A borescope examination is needed to establish whether cavity insulation is already present.

Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-EAW: The Party Wall etc. Act 1996 requires that Adjoining Owners are given notice of the intention to carry out work on a party wall, and contains provisions on preventing or resolving disputes in relation to party walls.
Recommendation.Improvement-Conditions-SCT: In relation to houses, both owners would normally have rights over a party wall. In relation to flats or maisonettes, the owner needs to be satisfied that he or she has obtained sufficient consent from other owners before carrying out works on communal property. In all cases, the owner will need to be satisfied that he or she has obtained all necessary consents e.g. building warrant, planning or listed building.
